channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Get ready for some obscene opining on MSNBC tonight. They like their TWTR and didn't think it could be bought. These people think of themselves as journalists. Oy.
I'll be watching Season 5 of Better Call Saul.

Private equity giant Thoma Bravo is working on a possible bid for Twitter, a source close to the situation told The Post — setting up what could be a rival to Elon Musk’s offer for the social giant. https://t.co/xITKmIOgZb percent20buttons&utm_campaign=site percent20buttons
When I switched from a Pixel 4a to an iPhone 13, I didn't realize that Google's messages app didn't work on iOS, which is causing me all kinds of problems. This stuff doesn't work, basically.
@chrislhayes Many think this is the first sign of maturity -- https://t.co/gGpO5M6jVg Also this -- https://t.co/UogAZlzdQP
This person claims to be a journalist. ⬇︎ https://t.co/tlo5daS5y4
Are you watching the TED interview of @elonmusk.
Elon Musk Is a Digital Citizen Kane. https://t.co/ua3VVbAkvG
Ukraine's President Zelensky to BBC: Blood money being paid for Russian oil. https://t.co/Kn3a3w3kq4
How much would you be willing to pay for Twitter?
The first thing is to make it much easier for apps to read feeds. https://t.co/HE2MoXISdd
Asking 80 Year Old Millionaires If It Was Worth It. https://t.co/icgIhq8BTw
Twitter users react to Elon Musk offering to buy the platform. https://t.co/j2YegbaeR5

FWIW, I warned in 2017 that Twitter's price was too low, and that a Republican backer like Shelly Adelson or the Koch Brothers could buy it and make it run like Fox News. More here... https://t.co/HKwOp63LEg
How Birds Aren’t Real took on the conspiracy theorists. https://t.co/KGpXdvGvVr
@rroudt I added a note -- https://t.co/yzPsP7rMyN
@rroudt The word I used is "concerned" and I chose it deliberately.

@CathyGellis Heh. I didn't say it was illegal, nor did I say how Trump used Twitter was illegal. I am not a lawyer, so my opinion on legality is fairly worthless. I used it as a quick way to call up in the reader's mind an idea they are familiar with.
Musk's Twitter, first comments. https://t.co/qQIO6BWLCc
@aboutmattlaw @jeffjarvis That is my current project. An RSS reader with Twitter's UI (only better). And I already have a number of blogging tools that all generate compatible RSS.
Russia already has nuclear weapons in the Baltic region, says Lithuania. https://t.co/4H3WQPOK3I

1/9 I think there are reasons to be optimistic about Musk's Twitter, if that comes to be.
2/9 For one thing, none of the CEOs of Twitter going back to the beginning were natural bloggers. Musk is.
3/9 When he was joining the board, I thought that was good because having a user on the board of a tech company is pretty unusual, and would be a good thing. Having a user as the CEO -- even better.
4/9 Also there's too much religion in the UI of Twitter. Musk's ideas were pragmatic. On the right path, imho.
5/9 I am a customer of Tesla and StarLink, and both companies appear to be run well, and what they do is imho harder than running Twitter, which basically is the kind of service the tech industry is good at running.
6/9 My main concern with Musk as the new owner of Twitter is that Trump will be back. I think it was proven beyond any doubt that Twitter can be grossly misused, and the company has to be ready to stop its service from being used in such a harmful way.
7/9 Free speech is not an absolute -- the old Yelling Fire in a crowded movie theater idea. Trump used Twitter to organize the overthrow of the US government and almost succeeded at it.
8/9 I am also concerned that Musk will curtail the Twitter API, which is incredibly useful and under-exploited by the company and its users. I've built a lot of tech on top of the API, and would miss it if it were gone.
9/9 Just some early morning thoughts on this topic, sure to be much discussed. ;-)
@DeanLand thanks dean.
Twitter, Inc. (TWTR) Stock Price, News, Quote & History - Yahoo Finance. https://t.co/5Y4PvILcxK
